holidays.name: National Chocolate Day (UK)
holidays.description: A delightful day dedicated to indulging in the rich, sweet, and decadent world of chocolate. Perfect excuse to eat chocolate in any form guilt-free!
holidays.origin: This unofficial holiday has been celebrated in the UK for years to promote chocolate and its delicious varieties.
holidays.funFact: The average British person consumes around 180 chocolate bars per year, and on this day, that number definitely spikes!

holidays.name: Steam Power Day
holidays.description: A quirky observance for enthusiasts of steam engines and the revolutionary power of steam technology during the Industrial Revolution.
holidays.origin: Informally celebrated by heritage railways and steam engine museums to honor the impact of steam locomotives and machinery on industry and society.
holidays.funFact: On Steam Power Day, some heritage railways run special steam train rides with coal-fired locomotives, towering over the rails in spectacular fashion.

holidays.name: Red Wine Day
holidays.description: A day for wine lovers to savor the depth, flavor, and complex aromas of red wine varieties from around the world.
holidays.origin: Originating as a fun social media trend encouraging enthusiasts to appreciate red wine without any guilt or excuses.
holidays.funFact: Research shows moderate red wine consumption may have heart benefits thanks to antioxidants like resveratrol found in grape skins.
